item.title: Real-Time Rendering 4th edition 学习笔记
item.description: Chapter 2 The Graphics Rendering Pipeline Application -> Geometry Processing -> Rasterization -> Pixel Processing Application Stage The developer has full control to determine the implementation. For example, an application stage algorithm or setting could decrease the number of triangles to be rendered. At the end of application stage, the geometry to be rendered is fed to the geometry processing stage. The rendering primitives: points, lines, triangles. To increase performance,
